item.title: Aukus: US and UK face international backlash over Australia defence deal
item.description: The nuclear submarine deal with Australia has angered France and raised fears of a war with China.

item.title: US immigration: Thousands gather under bridge at US-Mexico border in growing crisis
item.description: The mostly Haitian migrants are sleeping under the Del Rio bridge in squalid conditions.

item.title: California fires: General Sherman and other sequoias given blankets
item.description: Fire-resistant blankets protect General Sherman and other sequoias as a California blaze closes in.

item.title: New Zealand men abandon Pakistan tour after 'government security alert'
item.description: New Zealand men's team abandon their limited-overs tour of Pakistan following a New Zealand government "security alert".

item.title: Russian election: Opposition smart app removed as vote begins
item.description: The Smart Voting app promoted candidates most likely to defeat President Vladimir Putin's party.

item.title: Clinton-linked lawyer charged for lying in Trump-Russia origins probe
item.description: He is accused of hiding ties to the Clinton campaign when submitting a tip about Donald Trump.

item.title: Assam shorts: India teenager forced to cover legs with curtain at exam centre
item.description: The Indian student was stopped from entering exam centre after a teacher objected to her clothes.

item.title: Dutch Foreign Minister Sigrid Kaag quits over Afghanistan chaos
item.description: Sigrid Kaag is the first senior Western official to resign over the evacuation crisis last month.

item.title: The Activist: Priyanka Chopra 'sorry' for role on reality show
item.description: The show was originally pitched as a competition series but will now become a documentary.

item.title: China applies to join key Asia-Pacific trade pact
item.description: It comes the day after a regional security agreement between the US, UK and Australia was unveiled.

item.title: Covid: Italy to require all workers to show 'green pass' certificate
item.description: New rules mean workers must show they are vaccinated, have tested negative, or recovered from Covid.

item.title: US man files $1m lawsuit after Michigan teacher cuts child's hair
item.description: The US man says his daughter's rights were violated when she had her hair cut without permission.

item.title: German police arrest four over foiled Islamist synagogue attack
item.description: A 16-year-old Syrian boy was among those detained over a suspected Islamist plot, authorities say.

item.title: Vincent Van Gogh: Newly discovered drawing goes on display
item.description: Study for Worn Out has been sitting in a Dutch family's private collection for more than a century.

item.title: Why North Korea's cruise missile launch could worry other nations
item.description: Though cruise missiles are not banned by the UN, this test presents new problems for other nations.

item.title: Lil Nas X: Is the rapper the defining star of his generation?
item.description: The rapper has subverted hip-hop with his LGBT-positive lyrics, while dominating critics on social media.

item.title: Gen Z battles to bring back unions, one Starbucks at a time
item.description: Younger Americans are reviving US labour activism amid stagnant wages and Covid hardship.

item.title: Canada federal election: The man who could topple Trudeau
item.description: The new Conservative leader has tied Justin Trudeau in the polls with a pitch to moderate voters.

item.title: How TikTokers took down a Texas anti-abortion site
item.description: A draconian abortion ban in Texas has Gen Z fighting its enforcement through hacktivism

item.title: Is Aukus pact a power shift in Asia Pacific?
item.description: The agreement will increase Western presence in the region, amid concerns about China's growing influence.

item.title: Canada election: Lytton fire puts village at centre of debate
item.description: A village in western Canada recorded the country's highest-ever temperature. The next day it was gone.

item.title: North Korea reveals train-launched missile system
item.description: North Korean state media has unveiled what appears to be a new rail-based ballistic missile system.

item.title: Canadian prairie ranchers struggle with drought conditions
item.description: Amid a severe drought in the Prairies, some ranchers are trying to find ways to work with nature.

item.title: Ros Atkins on... why people are using a horse drug
item.description: Ivermectin is being used by some to treat Covid-19, despite the benefits being unproven.

item.title: On the trail of fake medicine smugglers in Benin
item.description: Since the beginning of the pandemic, thereâ€™s been an increase in counterfeit drugs around the world.

item.title: The homemakers breaking taboos on Instagram
item.description: Vasanti, Ritu and Pradnya, who have overcome huge challenges, now find joy performing on Instagram.
